page.title: 05CAREBY & HOLYWELL CHURCHES
page.content: The two churches in the block are both Church of England denomination.{ { St Wilfred's,}built soon after 1700, using stones from the ancient church at Aunby, stands in the grounds of Holywell Hall. Privately owned and maintained, it is not de-consecrated but it is classified as redundant. { St Stephen's,}Careby, dates in part from late Norman times. Services are held once every three weeks and on special occasions: weddings, Easter, Christmas etc. The congregation of 16 to 20 people come from nearby parishes as well as from Careby itself. Approximately Â£10,000 is required to repair the church tower. A barbecue, a flower festival and hunter trials have so far raised over Â£2,250. Labour is provided by the government-sponsored Manpower Services Commission, only the materials have to be paid for.
